channel.title: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?
channel.description:
I've forwarded ports, ive taken advice off of torrenting forums and nothing helps.
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img518.imageshack.us/img518/148/dvsnd6.jpg[/img][/URL]
If you can help get my speed up to at least 70 kb/s I'll give you what I got left in my PayPal (If I have anything left in there).
If not I'll give you a free members pin in a few weeks. Worth 1M.

item.title: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

Try torrenting straight from your internet source, or make sure the other computers on your network aren’t taking up all your bandwith. If nothing else, try switching clients.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?

item.title: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Mr. Chris, do a speed test. Make damn sure you have high speed.

Then check if that speed is high, are you 100% sure your ports are being forwarded correctly? Check this page with your port number after the = sign.

http://www.utorrent.com/testport.php?port=

If your port is being forwarded correctly then make sure the torrents you’re using have a lot of seeds. If they don’t then maybe that’s your problem.

Other than those suggestions, I really can’t think of any more.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?

item.title: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Tribal:

I’m not very fammiliar with such things but does every ISP have a download limit?

Nope. Many ISPs have different packages. The most expensive being unlimited downloads. Although, they must have a limit some time. You can’t be downloading 1TB a month.

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:26, topic:100765”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=144615.msg1385927#msg1385927 date=1180315473]
Here are a few ISPs I really recommend:
NDO
Wannado
Nildram (Of course :P)
PIPEX
Eclipse
[/quote]

I was thinking of getting Eclipse but my mum wants to get the full package from Virgin(EWW) with 2MB speeds(EWWWWWWWWW).[/quote]

Tell her she will only get ripped off.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:21, topic:100765”]Actually, I’m changing my ISP to Nildram

Virgin Media is bollucks david and goatee. Why:
Virgin Media actually cap your download speed at peak times! That’s 4PM to midnight when other ISPs, who cap, cap it at 6PM - midnight.
Users who download over 350MB will have their speed capped at 1Mbps during peak
Virgin Media customer service is regarded as ‘terrible’.
Lots of complaints on the internet about them over charging by £30 or more.

Here are some complaints I found in the first 2 pages of ‘Virgin Media Reviews’:

months to change to package 2 for £17.99 - not satisfied. 8mb is like old dialup. Slower than previous virgin.net 1mb. Looking to change ISP - been virgin.net customer since 1999 and since merger, really unhappy. Spent a fortune chasing up customer services over 3 months. No call backs. They blamed BT. They blamed my phoneline. They suggested unscrewing BTs box and messing with wires!!! Unbelievable. Don’t touch with a bargepole is my advice.

Virgin Media are absolutely terrible, I would advise anyone to steer well clear of this disater! I am a student, living in Bristol where Telewest had the monopoly on cable/broadband/tv/phone, and was a very happy customer. The price seemed good, the service was often upgraded (although I never checked the speed), they did what they said they would, and if you needed to you could talk to customer services.

Virgin Media yesterday said that it has lost nearly 50,000 customers this year and expects to los

Pretty much, stay well away from Richard Branson and his trains, planes, tv, internet, radio, cola and anything he else he decided to put a Virgin logo on and then fuck about with it.[/quote]

Well it has the fastest download speeds i , personally, have. Aynwho Virgin trains, planes and cola all own so who cares.

Read full topic

months to change to package 2 for £17.99 - not satisfied. 8mb is like old dialup. Slower than previous virgin.net 1mb. They blamed my phoneline. They suggested unscrewing BTs box and messing with wires!!! Unbelievable. Don't touch with a bargepole is my advice.

The price seemed good, the service was often upgraded (although I never checked the speed), they did what they said they would, and if you needed to you could talk to customer services.
Virgin Media yesterday said that it has lost nearly 50,000 customers this year and expects to los

Pretty much, stay well away from Richard Branson and his trains, planes, tv, internet, radio, cola and anything he else he decided to put a Virgin logo on and then fuck about with it.

item.title: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:17, topic:100765”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=144615.msg1380430#msg1380430 date=1180236920]

have you got two routers?

Nope, just the one.

well i belive it is probably ure isp… the fact that they say up to 8mb broadband could meen that its actually lower then 1mbps… but i really dont got a clue, im in uk (as well as you) and i use Aol silver and i always have my torrents running at 120kbps(equally divided usually).
I havent port forwarded or anything either (i dont even know what that is lol).
good luck anyway.

Yeh, BT is far too expensive for what it’s worth. I’m thinking about getting Virgin Media, but seen some bad reviews. Maybe AOL is the way to go for internet.
[/quote]

Virgin Media is 20mbps. I get 400-500kb/s It’s faster than AOL and BT broadband anyday. I only get like 150kb/s with BT (at my mummehs!).[/quote]
how much is virgin media and is it available in UK at the same speed?

Read full topic

item.source: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?

item.title: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

jme_009:

When I had a linksys router, I had the same problem. I had everything port forwarded properly and I was still lucky if I could get 1 kb/s. My router somehow got fried, and we bought an SMC one and everything worked much much better. My record is 600 kb/s on a torrent now, and my normal download speed is only about 200-300 kb.

After a few hours of talking to my cousin (Owns his own pc repair and maintenance company) he came to the conclusion that it is more than likely it’s my ISP. I’ve convinced my dad to change, and we are. Were changing the a company called Nildram. They look pretty good. My cousin uses them and my dads business uses them and he has amazing speeds.

Read full topic
item.source: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?

item.title: Why Is My Torrenting So Fucked?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:8, topic:100765”][quote author=h4xx0rz link=topic=144615.msg1380627#msg1380627 date=1180239963]
i think its fucked because: it feels like being fucked
[/quote]

Your an idiot. Before posting, think about what your going to say first.

I’ve forwarded ports, ive taken advice off of torrenting forums and nothing helps.

Do the torrents have a lot of seeders and peers? If you have 0 peers and only a few seeders, the torrent will download really slow.

If you want to change your ISP, I suggest you either go with AOL or SBC Yahoo.[/quote]

The C4D torrent has 31 seeders, so it couldn’t be the amount of seeders.

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:9, topic:100765”][quote author=davidude36 link=topic=144615.msg1380471#msg1380471 date=1180237442]
Everyone i talk to on the internet slags off AOL but ive never really had a problem…
If you are considering changing ISP’s google alot of research before choosing which one is the best.
[/quote]

My friend has aol and he downloads at 15~kb/s max.

Mr Chris, msg me on MSN, I have a belkin router, maybe I can help you.

Also, what is your usual download speed on stuff like rapidshare?[/quote]

Will do.

My usual download speed off of things like RapidShare is about 200 kb/s. God, I hate British ISPs. Rip off.

Read full topic
